column1: 6602148,1,B00MUF60E8,"Freaks and Geeks is a five star show for sure. Every single episode is hilarious and you can relate to almost every character in a way. My rating is based on the price for this. I understand there's a lot of ""interviews"" and ""extra footage"". But it's only one season! If the price ever drops, I'll consider purchasing this.",1457308800,17,323,4.491525423728813

6602149,3,B00MUF60E8,"Get a netflix account for $10 and watch the whole series in a weekend. Unless you NEED it on blu ray and care about interviews you can probably watch on youtube, then avoid this. Waste of money.",1457049600,10,194,4.27027027027027
6602150,5,B00MUF60E8,"An amazing show and ahead of it's time.
This Bluray (HD Version) of this series not only gives you the original 4:3 aspect ratio it also offers a 16:9 as well in 1080p. With a new interview with Paul Feig and Judd Apatow.
If you are like me and purchase the DVD Yearbook addition, the Blu-Ray version will have a digital version, or just the DVD complete series the extra features are pretty much going to be the same.

If you want the pretty sharper picture of this show get this box set. If you are fine with the Standard Definition version that you own, you'll want to get this for the eye candy crispness.",1457049600,18,608,4.2956521739130435

6602152,5,B00MUF60E8,"This review is mainly just a synopsis of the contents.  I skimmed a few episodes of the widescreen version of the show.  The images look great to me.  The show was filmed in widescreen and cropped for broadcast.

column1: 6602153,5,B00MUF60E8,"Freaks and Geeks was rhe BEST SHOW ever on TV, incredible soundtrack music in all episodes, I've seen every episode at least 5 Times - and I'm not finished yet !. The series appeared on Time magazine's 2007 ""100 Greatest Shows of All Time"" list, as well as placing third on the magazine's list of greatest television shows of the 2000s  In 2013 TV Guide included it in its list of The 60 Greatest Dramas of All Time[and ranked it #1 on their list of 60 shows that were ""Cancelled Too Soon""
This series is also highly reminiscent of 2 of the best 'teen' movies of all time, 'Fast Times At Ridgemont High' and 'American Graffiti""

It also reminds me a lot of Wonder Years. John Frances Daly as Sam Weir is a lot like Fred Savage as Kevin Arnold, and Martin Starr as Bill Haverchuck was similar to Josh Saviano as Paul Pfeiffer Some of my favorite moments are when James Franco gets his hair made up as a punk rocker so that he can impress one of his favorite ladies, Neal using his ventriloquist dummy to get revenge at his parent's cocktail party, Martin Starr playing spin-the bottle at the make-out party...each episode is just  priceless !!!
The following is the episode guide with musical selections:-
A group of high school students in 1980 faces various social struggles. Wealthy ""brain"" Lindsay wants to rebel. Her geeky freshman brother Sam and his two friends are targeted by a bully.
Running With The Devil - Van Halen
When Mr & Mrs. Weir go out of town for the weekend, Lindsey hosts a keg party. Sam, Bill, and Neal, worried that the party-goers will get too rowdy, substitute a keg of non-alcoholic beer
Rock And Roll Hootchie Koo - Rick Derringer
Halloween doesn't go as expected for Sam, Lindsey, or their parents.
The Monster Mash - Becky Ann Baker
Ep 4: Kim Kelly Is My Friend
Kim befriends Lindsay for ulterior motives, while Sam is bullied unmercifully by Karen Scarfolli, whose locker is next to his.
Daniel cons Lindsay into helping him pass an algebra test, while Sam and his pals try to figure out the basics of human sexuality
Lindsay encourages Nick to pursue a career in music. Nick continues to practice with his current band, but quickly decides he's better than them.
Sunshine Of Your Love - Seth Rogan

Sam, Neal, and Bill befriend a pretty new transfer student, but soon fear of losing her to the popular crowd and try to win her over with a series of fun things they plan for her. Lindsay, Nick, Daniel, and Ken decide to get fake IDs so they can see a hot local band perform at a bar.
You Were The One - Billy Joel
Don't Ask Me Why - Billy JoelI'm Eighteen - Dave Allen
Lindsay and Nick get more serious, and her parents give unwanted advice. Sam joins the yearbook staff to get closer to Cindy, who thinks of him only as a friend
Nights In White Satin - The Moody Blues

Sam tries out to be the school mascot hoping to impress Cindy. Meanwhile, Daniel, Ken, and Kim suddenly become the basketball team's most rabid fans following a series of run-ins with jocks from the rival school, Lincoln High. Lindsay tries to figure out the best way to break up with Nick.
Do You Wanna Touch Me - Joan Jett
The Song Is Over - The Who
Lindsay's parents are convinced Kim is leading their daughter down a path toward drugs and sex, so they consider taking a peek in her diary.
Journey To The Center Of The Mind - The Amboy Dukes
No Language In Our Lungs - XTC
Overture from Rocky II - Bill Conti
A car accident results in Lindsay deciding to stop hanging out with her ""freak"" friends. Sam adopts a new modern hair style in the hopes of impressing Cindy.
Take The Long Way Home - Supertramp
Neal learns his father is cheating on his mother. Ken develops a crush on the tuba player in the school's marching band and Lindsay helps set them up.
Let The Good Times Roll - The CARS
Devil Went Down To Georgia - Charlie Daniels Band
When Bill talks about being allergic to peanuts in class, Alan tries to prove he's lying but Bill ends up in the hospital after an allergic reaction. Lindsay smokes weed for the first time.
Baby Don't Get Hooked On Me - Mac Davis
Ep 14: Dead Dogs and Gym Teachers
Lindsay tries to convince Harold to let her join her friends at a Who concert.
Love Reign O'er Me - The Who

Neal wrestles with the dilemma of whether to tell his mother about his father's affair. Lindsay is given detention after coming to the aid of a girl being attacked by a boy. Daniel deals with pressures at home and with Kim.
You're Nobody 'Til Somebody Loves You - Dean Martin
Nick stays with the Weirs while he's on the outs with his dad, and the geeks go to a make-out party.
Poor Poor Pitiful Me - Warren Zevon
As McKinley High prepares for a visit from Vice President Bush, Ken and Sam must sort out conflicted feelings in their love lives
If My Friends Could See Me Now - Linda Clifford
Nick explores disco, Lindsay listens to the Grateful Dead, and Daniel tries something new. What's cool? Friendship.
I Don't Want To Be A Freak - Dynasty

6602155,4,B00MUF60E8,"The ultimate high school show of all time. Blurays look good. Hoping for GREAT but good will do for now. Still far superior to the DVDs. This show from Judd Apatow (the man who brought us ""The 40 Year Old Virgin"", ""Knocked Up"" and a slew of other popular comedies introduced the world to James Franco, Jason Seigel, Seth Rogen and a slew of others is a must see.",1482969600,,362,4.260869565217392

6602163,2,B00MUF60E8,"This is an amazing show. It would deserve 5 stars but the ""Complete series"" is only 1 season. So the price tag is way too high.",1458604800,12,127,3.923076923076923

8674677,5,B00MUF60E8,"Yes, it only lasted one season, but this one season is a perfect, funny, edgy slice of life that impacts and leaves an impression, moreso than most series do, regardless of how many episodes they ran.",1530230400,,200,4.583333333333333

8674678,4,B00MUF60E8,"Four stars for the transfer quality and the overall awesomeness of the show. One star deducted because contrary to what I had expected, Shout Factory did not secure the rights to the original music apparently.  Most of the original songs (as per Wikipedia listing for the show) have been replaced.",1528588800,2,297,4.94
8674679,5,B00MUF60E8,What a shame this brilliant series was canceled after only one season. How lucky are we to have it on bluray! Wonderful.,1526688000,,120,4.5
8674680,5,B00MUF60E8,"Great TV series, too bad it didn't last very long.",1526342400,,50,4.1

8674681,5,B00MUF60E8,"One of my favorite shows. Bummed it was canceled too soon. This bluray version just looks fantastic. Comparing to the 1080p HD versions on Netflix streaming, these bluray versions just so much better. I'm not a videophile to really describe all the detailed differences but I'll say the motion and clarity of the video just looks far better. It makes the show even more engaging. I feel like I'm noticing more detail in the expressions of the actors. A really cool collectable version of the show, I'm very pleased to own this set.",1511049600,2,531,4.720430107526882
8674682,5,B00MUF60E8,Love this series.  Too bad it didn't make it.,1508630400,,45,4.0
8674683,5,B00MUF60E8,"Such a well done show. Richly drawn characters, and a beautiful series arc for a show that didn't know it was going to end when it did.",1504396800,,135,4.037037037037037
8674684,5,B00MUF60E8,"I had fond memories of this TV show, and I'm really enjoying watching this collection.  It's simple entertainment.",1504051200,,114,5.333333333333333
8674685,5,B00MUF60E8,"Short lived, but well lived like a character of legacy in real life.
Freaks and Geeks kick-started many a comedy enthusiast's career, obliged itself to a nudge for some, and became a sensation that was cemented into comedy so uniquely that it was tragic to see it go.

This collection gives us a two-fer. Not only do we get the original full-screen presentation of the show, but we now get the widescreen editions of all the episodes. They come as separate cases, so there is no confusion. You get the usual assortment of extras, good video and audio, and a nice case to fit it all in.

This show had Paul Feig (Bridesmaids, Knocked Up, Ghostbusters 2016) helm it with support from Judd Apatow (whose catalog is so much more substantial and has had occasional Feig influence), Within only a handful of episodes, you see an actor from the Apatow catalog appear, such as James Franco, Seth Rogen, Jason Segel, with occasional appearances from various others. The show had done much within the episodes it had to work with, leaving room for much more but getting outdone like so many.

The big kicker is the music. This show, like many, used licensed music for much of its tone and presentation. Because so many notable artists had music in the show, it created a difficulty trying to produce physical copies of it. Fortunately, Shout! Factory came through and managed it and went a step further to give us this. It's perhaps the best consolidation of the show you're going to get.
If you're a fan of comedy, this show is worth adding to your catalog. It's the Breakfast Club, done Apatow/Feig style and manages to do it well.",1502582400,,1625,4.648083623693379
8674686,4,B00MUF60E8,"this didn't last long enough, had a lot of talent in the cast",1500336000,,61,3.769230769230769
